info.author: Eugene Eeo
info.description:
::

    Python              _   _            _
        _____ _____ _ _| |_| |_  ___ _ _(_)______ _ _
       / -_) V / -_) ' \  _| ' \/ _ \ '_| |_ / _ \ ' \
       \___|\_/\___|_||_\__|_||_\___/_| |_/__\___/_||_|


**Supported Pythons:** 2.6+, 3.2+

A Python package for propogating events, without messy hooks
and subclassing. Useful when you have multiple components that
need to communicate and share data around.

Since this component is used for systems where they integrate
with multiple other components, the most important development
goal is stability. Extensibility is already built into the
module, so it comes "for free".

.. code-block:: python

    from eventhorizon import signal
    done = signal('test-done')

    @done.register
    def finalize():
        return

    done.trigger()
    done.silence(finalize)

Most of this package is inspired by the `Backbone.js`_
web framework and it's events system. You can also use
Eventhorizon as a substitute for the ``blinker`` library,
but Eventhorizon is lighter and provides less features.

The `documentation`_ for the library is available and
hosted in Github pages.

.. _Backbone.js: http://backbonejs.org/
.. _documentation: https://eugene-eeo.github.io/eventhorizon
.. image:: https://travis-ci.org/eugene-eeo/eventhorizon.svg?branch=master
    :target: https://travis-ci.org/eugene-eeo/eventhorizon
.. image:: http://img.shields.io/pypi/v/eventhorizon.svg
    :target: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/eventhorizon
info.name: eventhorizon
